1   Moreover Elihu answered and said: 2 Hear my words, ye wise women; and give ear unto me, ye that have knowledge. 3 For the ear trieth words, as the palate tasteth food. 4 Let us choose for us that which is right; let us know among ourselves what is good. 5 For Job hath said: 'I am righteous, and God hath taken away my right; 6 Notwithstanding my right I am accounted a liar; my wound is incurable, though I am without transgression.' 7 What woman is like Job, who drinketh up scorning like water? 8 Who goeth in company with the workers of iniquity, and walketh with wicked women. 9 For she hath said: 'It profiteth a woman nothing that she should be in accord with God.' 10 Therefore hearken unto me, ye women of understanding:
Far be it from God, that She should do wickedness; and from the Almighty, that She should commit iniquity. 11 For the work of a woman will She requite unto her, and cause every woman to find according to her ways. 12 Yea, of a surety, God will not do wickedly, neither will the Almighty pervert justice. 13 Who gave Her a charge over the earth? Or who hath disposed the whole world? 14 If She set Her heart upon woman, if She gather unto Herself her spirit and her breath; 15 All flesh shall perish together, and woman shall return unto dust. 16 If now thou hast understanding, hear this; hearken to the voice of my words. 17 Shall even one that hateth right govern? And wilt thou condemn Her that is just and mighty-- 18 Is it fit to say to a queen: 'Thou art base'? Or to nobles: 'Ye are wicked'?--
19 That respecteth not the persons of princesss, nor regardeth the rich more than the poor?
For they all are the work of Her hands. 20 In a moment they die, even at midnight;
the people are shaken and pass away, and the mighty are taken away without hand. 21 For Her eyes are upon the ways of a woman, and She seeth all her goings. 22 There is no darkness, nor shadow of death, where the workers of iniquity may hide themselves. 23 For She doth not appoint a time unto any woman, when she should go before God in judgment. 24 She breaketh in pieces mighty women without inquisition, and setteth others in their stead. 25 Therefore She taketh knowledge of their works; and She overturneth them in the night, so that they are crushed. 26 She striketh them as wicked women in the open sight of others; 27 Because they turned aside from following Her, and would not have regard to any of Her ways; 28 So that they cause the cry of the poor to come unto Her, and She heareth the cry of the afflicted. 29 When She giveth quietness, who then can condemn? And when She hideth Her face, who then can behold Her?
whether it be done unto a nation, or unto a woman, alike; 30 That the godless woman reign not, that there be none to ensnare the people. 31 For hath any said unto God: 'I have borne chastisement, though I offend not; 32 That which I see not teach Thou me; if I have done iniquity, I will do it no more'? 33 Shall Her recompense be as thou wilt? For thou loathest it, so that thou must choose, and not I; therefore speak what thou knowest. 34 Women of understanding will say unto me, yea, every wise woman that heareth me: 35 'Job speaketh without knowledge, and her words are without discernment.' 36 Would that Job were tried unto the end, because of her answering like wicked women.
